network

Class InputLink<T extends Message>

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.Link<T>
      • network.WrapperLink<T>
        • network.InputLink<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of message the link transmits.

    public final class InputLink<T extends Message>
extends WrapperLink<T>
    Implements a WrapperLink that only permits usage of a Link for receiving data.
    Author:
    Bitidork
    See Also:
    WrapperLink

      Constructor and Description
      InputLink(Link<T> link)
      Constructs an InputLink that wraps the suppled link.

    • Method Detail

      • transmit

        public void transmit(int time,
            T data)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from class: Link
        Transmits object data from the source to the sink.

        This method should be implemented in such a way that does not presume on the order of delivery. In other words, a source may send data before the receiver accepts data on the same time slot, but that data should not be retrieved in receive.

        This method must be reentrant.

        Specified by:
        transmit in class Link<T extends Message>
        Parameters:
        time - The time at which transmission should start.
        data - The data to transmit over the link.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this link is unable to transmit data

      • receive

        public java.util.Queue<T> receive(int time)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from class: Link
        Pulls the data that is ready to be received at the start of time into a Queue.

        This method should be implemented in such a way that does not presume on the order of delivery. In other words, a source may send data before the receiver accepts data on the same time slot, but that data should not be retrieved in receive.

        This method must be reentrant.

        Specified by:
        receive in class Link<T extends Message>
        Parameters:
        time - The time at which the receiver attempts to pull data.
        Returns:
        Returns a Queue of data items in the order they were transmitted, up to the start of time slot time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this link is unable to receive data

      • canTransmit

        public boolean canTransmit(int time)
        Description copied from class: Link
        Determines whether or not data may be transmitted at the start of the supplied time slot.
        Specified by:
        canTransmit in class Link<T extends Message>
        Parameters:
        time - The time slot to perform this check at.
        Returns:
        Returns true if and only if data can be transmitted at the start of time slot time.
